docs.title: 🥋 Judo Framework
docs.text:
A comprehensive API testing framework for Python

Inspired by Karate Framework

docs.title: 🌟 Why Judo Framework?
docs.text:
"As simple as Karate, as powerful as Python"

Judo Framework brings the simplicity and elegance of Karate Framework to the Python ecosystem. Write API tests in plain English (or Spanish!), get beautiful HTML reports automatically, and enjoy the power of Python's ecosystem.

docs.title: ✨ Key Features
docs.text:
• Simple Setup

    Just 10 lines of code to get started. No complex configuration needed.

    Quick Start

  • Bilingual Support

    Write tests in English or Spanish. Full language support for both.

    Examples

  • Beautiful Reports

    Automatic HTML reports with request/response details, no configuration needed.

    HTML Reports

  • Parallel Execution

    Run tests faster with built-in parallel execution support.

    Parallel Execution

  • File Support

    Load test data from JSON, YAML, or CSV files like Karate's read().

    File Support

  • Xray Integration

    Export results to Jira Xray with automatic Cucumber JSON generation.

    Xray Integration

docs.title: 🚀 Quick Example
docs.text:
EnglishSpanish 
Feature: User API Testing

  Scenario: Create a new user
    Given the base URL is "https://api.example.com"
    When I send a POST request to "/users" with JSON:
      """
      {
        "name": "John Doe",
        "email": "john@example.com"
      }
      """
    Then the response status should be 201
    And the response should contain "id"
    And the response field "name" should equal "John Doe"

Característica: Pruebas de API de Usuarios

  Escenario: Crear un nuevo usuario
    Dado que la URL base es "https://api.example.com"
    Cuando hago una petición POST a "/users" con el cuerpo:
      """
      {
        "name": "Juan Pérez",
        "email": "juan@example.com"
      }
      """
    Entonces el código de respuesta debe ser 201
    Y la respuesta debe contener el campo "id"
    Y el campo "name" debe ser "Juan Pérez"

docs.title: 📦 Installation

That's it! No additional dependencies or configuration needed.

docs.title: 🌐 Complete HTTP Testing
docs.text:
All HTTP methods with full control:

Scenario: Complete CRUD operations
  Given the base URL is "https://api.example.com"

  # CREATE
  When I send a POST request to "/users" with JSON:
    """
    {"name": "John", "email": "john@example.com"}
    """
  Then the response status should be 201
  And I extract "id" from the response as "userId"

  # READ
  When I send a GET request to "/users/{userId}"
  Then the response status should be 200

  # UPDATE
  When I send a PUT request to "/users/{userId}" with JSON:
    """
    {"name": "John Updated"}
    """
  Then the response status should be 200

  # DELETE
  When I send a DELETE request to "/users/{userId}"
  Then the response status should be 204

docs.title: 🎭 Custom Runners
docs.text:
Create powerful test runners with advanced features:

from judo.runner.base_runner import BaseRunner

class MyRunner(BaseRunner):
    def __init__(self):
        super().__init__(
            features_dir="features",
            output_dir="test_reports",
            console_format="progress",      # Clean output
            generate_cucumber_json=True,    # Xray integration
            parallel=True,                  # Faster execution
            max_workers=8
        )

    def run_smoke_tests(self):
        return self.run(tags=["@smoke"])

# Run tests
runner = MyRunner()
results = runner.run_smoke_tests()

Learn more about runners

docs.title: 📊 Automatic HTML Reports
docs.text:
Every test run generates a comprehensive HTML report with:

No configuration needed - reports are generated automatically!

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• Python 3.8 or higher
  • pip (Python package manager)

docs.title: Install from PyPI
docs.text:
The easiest way to install Judo Framework is using pip:

pip install judo-framework

This will install Judo Framework and all its dependencies.

docs.title: Verify Installation
docs.text:
Check that Judo Framework is installed correctly:

python -c "import judo; print(judo.__version__)"

You should see the version number printed.

docs.title: Install Specific Version
docs.text:
To install a specific version:

pip install judo-framework==1.2.11

docs.title: Upgrade to Latest Version
docs.text:
To upgrade to the latest version:

pip install --upgrade judo-framework

docs.title: Install from Source
docs.text:
If you want to install from source (for development):

git clone https://github.com/FelipeFariasAlfaro/Judo-Framework.git
cd Judo-Framework
pip install -e .

docs.title: Dependencies
docs.text:
Judo Framework automatically installs these dependencies:

  • requests - HTTP client
  • behave - BDD framework
  • jsonpath-ng - JSON path expressions
  • pyyaml - YAML support
  • jsonschema - Schema validation
  • jinja2 - Template engine

docs.text: For additional features, install optional dependencies:

docs.title: Virtual Environment (Recommended)
docs.text:
It's recommended to use a virtual environment:

# Create virtual environment
python -m venv venv

# Activate (Windows)
venv\Scripts\activate

# Activate (Linux/Mac)
source venv/bin/activate

# Install Judo Framework
pip install judo-framework

docs.title: Permission Errors
docs.text:
If you get permission errors, try:

pip install --user judo-framework

docs.title: SSL Certificate Errors
docs.text:
If you have SSL certificate issues:

pip install --trusted-host pypi.org --trusted-host files.pythonhosted.org judo-framework

docs.title: Behind a Proxy
docs.text:
If you're behind a proxy:

pip install --proxy http://user:password@proxy:port judo-framework
